leads.lead_text: Abscission scar where the proximal and distal fruit segments separate is flat when view laterally; lower fruit segment much narrower than the upper, without lateral projections

Abscission scar where the proximal and distal fruit segments separate is V-shaped when viewed laterally; lower fruit segment often almost as broad as the upper, with or without a pair of weakly to strongly developed lateral projections (horns)
